intro: Pavonia leiocarpa, commonly known as the silky pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red bracts that surround its small, yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Pavonia leiocarpa is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
